items.title: [a11y]: File uploader file delete button needs more context

labels.name: severity: 2
labels.description: Affects major functionality, has a workaround

items.body:
### Package @carbon/react ### Browser Chrome ### Operating System MacOS ### Package version n/a ### React version _No response_ ### Automated testing tool and ruleset inspect ### Assistive technology _No response_ ### Description As discussed at CAG, files uploaded through the File Uploader component can be removed, but the file's name is not part of the delete mechanism. When multiple files are uploaded, all the delete mechanisms ('x') are just called "Delete" (or sometimes "clear'). Since there is no confirmation prompt before deleting, it is especially important that a user who cannot see has an ability to know which file is being deleted. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14298245/162801237-b974cad0-6361-4b04-ab1d-d464bf583579.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14298245/162801973-ec1734ca-c757-4144-97f7-57162ffd11f3.png) There are several ways of resolving, this, including constructing each uploaded file as an object. However, the simplest thing to do is: 1. Consistently change the default aria-label to "delete" instead of 'clear'. 2. provide the file name through aria-describedby ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14298245/162802658-625108ee-ffcb-443a-8284-bdf3c6d7e1fa.png) `

button_usage_25.png

items.title: SideNavLink element to support `<Button>`
items.body:
Use this template if you want to request a new feature, or a change to an
existing feature.

If you are reporting a bug or problem, please use the bug template instead.

### Summary

Currently, the `SideNavLink` component accepts an `element` prop which is defaulted to an `a`. This is helpful when utilizing Gatsby, as you can set the element prop to `Link` and use the `to` attribute. However, in some instances, such as in [CreateTearsheet](https://ibm-cloud-cognitive.netlify.app/?path=/story/cloud-cognitive-canary-createtearsheet--with-view-all-toggle), the `SideNavLink` is used to bring you to different parts of the inner content of the modal. It would be great if you could set the element prop to a `Button` but currently all of the side nav link styles are only for `a` tags.

Clarify if you are asking for design, development, or both design and
development.

### Justification

A button here makes sense because we aren't redirecting or sending users' to another URL or location in the browser.

### "Must have" functionality

Prop for element accepts `Button` and applies all applicable styling

items.title: [Bug]: Carbon 11 Button's renderIcon does not position correctly for functions
items.body:
### Package

@carbon/react

### Browser

Firefox

### Package version

v11

### React version

v18

### Description

With Carbon 11, you can pass in a size to an icon such that instead of doing this in v10

```
import { Add24 } from '@carbon/icons-react';
```

you can do this in v11

```
import { Add } from '@carbon/react/icons';
...
<Add size={24} />
```

So here is my issue, before I could pass a Icon object into the `renderIcon` of a `Button` component as such 

```
 <Button renderIcon={Add24} />
```    

But if we wanted to use the new carbon 11 way passing in a size as such, you have to use a function for this to work 



```
 <Button renderIcon={() => <Add size={24}>} />
```    

Now I noticed these two different ways the icon position is off. 

Using an object (passing in something like `Add24`)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8866319/162104232-0d408fac-ef47-4acd-8f6c-6d4f94898142.png)


Passing in a function (`() => <Add size={24}>`)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8866319/162104423-c35c59ff-b952-4acb-bfda-17df25e816a9.png)

The pos is off. I know we can just import bot h`Add` and `Add24` to solvethis , but wanted to ask if I was doing something wrong or if this was ab ug?

N/A

items.title: [a11y]:  File uploader error message not announced or exposed on button focus
items.body:
### Package

@carbon/react

### Browser

Chrome

### Operating System

_No response_

### Package version

https://react.carbondesignsystem.com/?path=/story/components-fileuploader--file-uploader

### React version

_No response_

### Automated testing tool and ruleset

n/a

### Assistive technology

JAWS

### Description

When a user uploads too large a file, a message "File size exceeds limit" is displayed, along with a warning symbol. If this implementation is going to be accessible the message:
1. needs to be exposed when it appears
2. needs to be announced when focus lands on the associated delete button.

![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/1900/files/5a478b00-b3ea-11ec-9ae1-8be5e814a454)

Problems captured in [ issues with JAWS in video](https://ibm.box.com/s/9g8i7u4jyosqhdpjz2mhn2fwkrkxdxzy). 

I'll mention that I suspect this 'file' is not even equivalent to the regular file that appears after uploading (since the file has not uploaded, right). It is probably better to just expose this error message as a modal. It would never appear in the list because it wasn't uploaded. That would involve design, but is the recommended approach.

Barring that, putting both the error and  the message into an alert region and making it an aria-describedby of the delete button would accomplish it, I think.
>File size exceeds limit
500kb max file size. Select a new file and try again.
 


### WCAG 2.1 Violation

[WCAG 3.3.1 Error Identification](https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/minimize-error-identified.html), etc.

### CodeSandbox example

https://react.carbondesignsystem.com/?path=/story/components-fileuploader--drag-and-drop-upload-container-example-application

### Steps to reproduce


To replicate
1. Start JAWS
2. choose a file that is larger than 500kb for upload. The focus seems to move to the new file and it will be outlined in red. However, focus is not actually there, and the text will not be announced
3. Tab to the 'file' in error. The text will not be announced.

items.title: [a11y]: ComposedModal - VO - when closing modal, user becomes stuck on close button
items.body:
### Package

carbon-components-react

### Browser

Safari

### Operating System

MacOS

### Package version

10.55.0

### React version

16.9.0

### Automated testing tool and ruleset

Manual testing

### Assistive technology

iPhone 12 - VoiceOver

### Description

When using VO on iPhone in Safari, user gets stuck on the close button when they close the `ComposedModal`

One thing I did to try to fix this issue on my end, was to pass a function to the `buttonOnClick` prop of the `ModalHeader` component that would set the focus back to the trigger element on modal close. However, the `onBlur` of the `ComposedModal` interferes with this, triggering the `wrapFocus()` and sets the focus to an item within the modal (which at that point is closed).


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54281166/159930948-f1d44af0-1a38-41bf-8a1d-9d4899caccfb.mov

items.title: Data Table: Cancel button for batch actions
items.body:
Just passing along some feedback received regarding the "Cancel" button for the action bar. 

**Feedback:**
Received a comment that it was not immediately understandable as to what that button would do if clicked, as they would just expect it to be labeled "unselect all." Was confused as to why that would be an option while also pressing the 'select/unselect all' checkbox on the table would perform the same action.

Curious if anyone has ever had this same comment or confusion as to what "cancel" would do.

**Suggestion:**
Could add a tooltip giving a simple explanation that cancel will unselect all selections and reset the table to the previous state.

## What package(s) are you using?
- [x] `carbon-components` - 10.12.0
- [x] `carbon-components-react` - 7.12.0

## Detailed description

I have a tree view structure where the expand/collapse buttons are Carbon's Icon only Buttons. I noticed the following issues with respect to the tooltip - 

- The tooltip pops up instantly while moving the mouse over them. This gets intrusive as the buttons are adjacent to each other. It would be convenient to have a delay for these tooltips.
- The tooltip seems to be clickable and it triggers the button's onClick action.
- The tooltip is retained after an on click action (As long as the button stays in focus).

items.title: 'Today' or 'Current' button on date picker
items.body:
### Summary

On the date picker, it would be nice to have an option to quickly navigate to the current date. 

### Justification

We have had a number of customers request this in our software, but it looks like it's not currently supported in Carbon 10.

### Desired UX and success metrics

I don't mind about the interface - just that there is a way to navigate back to 'today' with one click. Most date pickers seem to do this with a 'today' button under the calendar.

items.body:
<!--

Hi there! 👋 Hope everything is going okay using projects from the Carbon Design

Workspaces:

For non-IBMer's you can ask a question on our [Github Discussions board](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/discussions/new) or join [our Discord server](https://discord.gg/R7Hn2A96) to chat with Carbon maintainers and fellow community members.

-->

We are needing to perform validation on the Radio Button similar to how it is done for the Select Component where a red box will form around the element and red warning text will appear. I notice in the React Storybook that there is no invalid parameter for Radio. Is there no way to perform form validation for Radio Buttons just like it is performed for Select components? Thanks.

items.title: Adding className property to the radio of the radio button
items.body:
We've got a use case to provide 3 options, with radio buttons. 2 of these options have additional text inputs to enable our use case.
We've managed to get the following without any overrides to Carbon (just providing classNames and CSS to the right pieces) but are stuck with this alignment of the actual radio button:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2086381/81315718-90572580-9082-11ea-9158-01e889dfd679.png)

Ideally we'd just like to be a able to add a property to the radio selector itself:
`.bx--radio-button__appearance ${optional class here}`.

Is there a more 'Carbon approved' way of handling this scenario? Or would it be possible to have this optional class plumbed in?

cc. @matthew-chirgwin
